intro: Angelica longicaudata, commonly known as the long-tailed angelica, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Angelica longicaudata thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
